content: PROTECTION OF EMPLOYEES FROM RETALIATION BY THEIR EMPLOYER FOR COOPERATING IN INVESTIGATIONS. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation. Prohibition against employer retaliation for employee reporting violations or refusing to participate in misconduct. The employee is protected from employer retaliation for reporting violations, refusing to participate in misconduct, providing information to Congress or relevant proceedings, and initiating actions related to noncompliance with the Act.
